meanings.sent1: The sulphured fruit had a distinct smell.
meanings.sent2: The sulphured apricots lasted longer than the fresh ones.
meanings.sent3: The sulphured grapes were so wrinkled, they looked like little raisins!
meanings.sent4: The sulphured wood had a mysterious, smoky aura.
meanings.sent5: The sulphured eggs had a yellowish tint that made them stand out.

meanings.definition: To treat or preserve with sulfur.
meanings.sent1: The chef sulphured the meat to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: Farmers sulphured the crops to protect them from pests.
meanings.sent3: I sulphured my shoes to keep them from smelling bad!
meanings.sent4: She sulphured her memories to make them last forever.
meanings.sent5: The artist sulphured the canvas to give it a unique texture.
